description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5l46k","text":"This protocol aims to establish a robust Cas9 expression system in cancer organoids through a three-stage process. The first stage involves titrating blasticidin to determine the optimal concentration for eliminating wild-type cells while supporting the survival and growth of Cas9-expressing cells. The second step introduces the Cas9 gene, and the specified blasticidin concentration selects and maintains Cas9-positive cells. The final stage assesses Cas9 activity, ensuring functionality is above 75%. This established system facilitates precise and genome-wide gene modification using the 'lentiCas9-Blast' CRISPR-Cas9 guide RNA system. guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1abc","text":"Ensure the cell suspension is mixed thoroughly at each step to create an even single-cell suspension before plating, using reservoirs and multi-channel pipettes where possible to minimise ergonomic strain and to maintain homogenous solutions throughout.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dluar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"659d","text":"Avoid prolonged maintenance of organoids in a single-cell state. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emnh1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aga1o","text":"Refrain from the freeze/thaw cycle of virus stocks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"248ns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73vfs","text":"Prioritise using freshly prepared virus stocks to maintain optimal viral integrity.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ancvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77hcb","text":"Ensure the correct concentration of virus is used in the experimental setup.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tpfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44rgt","text":"Adequate dissociation is critical for efficient viral exposure and subsequent gene delivery.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brd36","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82kum","text":"Be aware that some cell lines may exhibit lower uptake of viral particles; which may make them unsuitable for this process.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59d26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uil9","text":"Black-walled 96-well plates are used in this protocol, as we have found luminescence can carry over into neighbouring wells in clear plates.
